Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech.
No government or official is qualified to decide what opinions should be censored.
Censorship is historically linked to authoritarian regimes.
Governments and bureaucracies cannot be trusted as arbiters of truth due to potential influences from ideology, politics, and money.
Historical examples, such as the changing views on homosexuality, illustrate the dangers of government-controlled censorship.
Media, both legacy and new, are biased and cannot be trusted to determine truth.
Recent examples from the COVID-19 pandemic show government censorship of information that was later proven to be valid.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is crucial to any free and democratic society.
History shows us that censorship has preceded every transition towards totalitarian / authoritarian government.
Trust in Government, Politicians, and Mainstream Media is at an all time low.
